benchmark_details.name: RadGraph: Extracting Clinical Entities and Relations from Radiology Reports
benchmark_details.overview: RadGraph is a dataset of clinical entity and relation annotations in full-text chest X-ray radiology reports, designed to facilitate various healthcare applications through a novel information extraction schema.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a structured dataset of clinical entities and relations from radiology reports to enhance research in medical NLP and multi-modal learning.

data.source: 500 radiology reports from the MIMIC-CXR dataset and 100 reports from the CheXpert dataset, annotated by board-certified radiologists.
data.size: 500 reports for development dataset and up to 220,763 reports for inference dataset.
data.annotation: Annotations were done manually by board-certified radiologists.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the performance of a model compared to independent radiologist annotations for entity and relation extraction.
methodology.interpretation: A predicted entity is correct if both the span boundaries and entity types are correct; for relations, both entity pairs and relation types must be accurate.
methodology.baseline_results: RadGraph Benchmark achieved a micro F1 of 0.82 on MIMIC-CXR and 0.73 on CheXpert for relation extraction.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset includes demographic statistics related to sex, age, and race, enhancing the assessment of fairness in the context of clinical applications.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Each report is de-identified in compliance with HIPAA regulations.
